def pivot_table(
    data,
    values=None,
    index=None,
    columns=None,
    aggfunc="mean",
    fill_value=None,
    margins=False,
    dropna=True,
    margins_name="All",
    observed=False,
) -> "DataFrame":
    # Existing code
    # ...
    
    if columns and not isinstance(columns, list):
        columns = [columns]

    # New code to handle multi-index columns
    if columns and len(columns) > 1:
        if values:
            raise ValueError("Grouper for columns not supported with values")

        if len(columns) > 2:
            raise NotImplementedError("Handling of more than two columns in pivot_table is not supported")

        index_columns = columns[0]
        pivot_columns = columns[1]

        tbl = data.pivot_table(
            values=values,
            index=index,
            columns=index_columns,
            fill_value=fill_value,
            aggfunc=aggfunc,
            margins=margins,
            dropna=dropna,
            margins_name=margins_name,
            observed=observed,
        )

        if pivot_columns:
            tbl.columns = MultiIndex.from_product([[pivot_columns], tbl.columns])

        return tbl
imports: from pandas import DataFrame, MultiIndex, Index
